description: Special Contract Rates

logic_steps.note: Service under SC12 is available to Non-Residential Customers eligible under SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, and SC-7, subject to eligibility criteria and Company discretion.

logic_steps.reference: Customer charges are as per the applicable standard tariff rates SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, or SC-7.
Energy charges are as per the applicable standard tariff rates SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, or SC-7.
Demand charges are as per the applicable standard tariff rates SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, or SC-7.

logic_steps.note: Customers receiving service under SC12 are subject to a Minimum Bill provision as defined in the tariff.
Qualifying Customers may receive standardized discounts or negotiate individual rates under Section 5 or 6 of SC12, based on eligibility and Company discretion.

notes: SC12 does not define explicit standalone charges; it references standard tariff rates of SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, and SC-7.
Discounts and eligibility criteria are programmatic and handled via Customer Service Agreements.
No explicit numeric rates or formulas are provided in this text for SC12 charges.
Charges and rates should be derived from the referenced standard tariff rates applicable to the customer.

description: Residential and Farm Service - Standard Tariff
notes: Monthly minimum charge is $19.00. Company supplied electricity supply service charges are separate and set according to Rule 46.1.

description: Residential and Farm Service - Optional Time of Use Delivery and Commodity Rate

logic_steps.conditions: Applies only to customers electing this TOU option; waived for customers with verified plug-in electric vehicle (PEV) or participating in Clifton Park Demand Reduction REV Demonstration Project.
Applies during Super Peak (Jun-Jul-Aug 2pm-6pm weekdays) and On Peak (7am-11pm all year round) periods
Applies during Off Peak (11pm-7am all year round) period

notes: Customers must install necessary metering equipment. Standard Tariff Charges also apply in addition to these TOU charges.

description: Residential and Farm Service - Optional Large Time of Use Rate
note: This service classification is canceled. No active rate logic available.

description: Residential and Farm Service - Optional Large Time of Use Rate
notes: Energy Supply Service (ESS) charges are separate and based on market price per Rule 46.1 and are not included here.
Rate periods and time-of-use definitions apply for ESS charges but are not explicitly priced in this tariff.
Adjustments and surcharges per various Rules (32.2, 40.1.8, 40.3, 41, 42, 43, 45, 46, 49, 50, 52, 56, 57, 59, 64, 67, 68, 69, 73) may apply but are outside this base tariff logic.
No demand or reactive charges are specified for this classification.
Special provisions apply for eligibility, net metering, budget billing, and energy affordability program credits.

description: Untransformed Service to Certain Customers Taking Power from Projects of the New York Power Authority

logic_steps.note: Rates applicable for Niagara Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, and SC-4 Supplemental Service are for a calendar month billing period.

logic_steps.calculation: Demand billed is the greater of: (1) the amount by which the overall max 30-minute integrated demand exceeds the sum of demands for Niagara Power Delivery Service (loss adjusted), Preservation Power Delivery Service (loss adjusted), HLF Delivery Service (meter determined), and EDP/PFJ Power; (2) contracted SC-4 Supplemental Service demand; or (3) minimum demand provisions of Parent Service Classification.

Billed kWh is the amount by which total kWh at delivery voltage exceeds the sum of kWh received from Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and EDP/PFJR Service under Rule 34, per 30-minute interval.
Reactive Demand is the highest average RkVA of lagging reactive demand over a 30-minute interval during the month less one-third of the highest kW demand measured during the month.

logic_steps.note: SC-4 Supplemental Service customers are assigned a Parent Service Classification (SC-3A before or after Sept 1, 1998, or SC-3) which determines applicable rates, terms, and conditions except for EJP qualifying load under SC-4 special provisions.

Billed demands and energies for Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and Replacement Power Rate 2 are adjusted for losses between customer meter and respective switchyards as specified in Rule 39.18.

description: Combined 25 and 60 Hertz Service
note: Service Classification No. 5 is canceled. No active tariff logic to extract.

description: Purchase of Electric Energy and Capacity from Customers with Qualifying On-Site Generation Facilities

logic_steps.notes: Real Time LBMP in $/MWh for each generator bus; if unavailable, nearest bus or Load Zone price used; Q_i is energy delivered in kWh per hour; Incurred Cost includes NYISO penalties.
Capacity is Unforced Capacity recognized by NYISO for the month, capped at 5000 kW for contracts on or after July 1, 2019; LBMCP defined in Rule 1.64.
Rate to be paid shall be no less than 6.0 cents per kWh, averaged annually and trued-up monthly.
For qualifying small random suppliers electing non-time differentiated basis; deliveries measured by standard kWh meter; customer pays installed cost of metering equipment instead of other charges.

logic_steps.step_name: Customer Charge and Buyback Contract Demand Charge
logic_steps.reference: Customer Charge and Buyback Contract Demand Charge are based on customer's otherwise applicable service classification for delivery service; if service under both SC-6 and another classification, SC-6 Customer Charge waived and Demand Charge applies only to demand in excess of other classification.
